Me ha gustado la atención del lugar, en recepción totalmente amables, es de destacar que si un o quiere ir a descansar, a pesar de estar un lugar céntrico, el ambien es demasadio tranquilo, no hay ruidos no ha escandalos, el área de alberca es genial donde puedes estar en la noche tomando un cafe y sentir el pasto en tus pies. 
Hago mucha énfasis en eL personal de recepción, ya que te brindan mucha atención y esmero por atender a nosotros los huéspedes.
no tengo nada que opinar al respecto.
Ubicación
No hay estacionamiento

Nos gustó bastante este hotel ya que es un hotel relativamente pequeño, la atención del joven que nos recibió, a pesar de ser nuevo, fue bastante eficiente. La habitación estaba en planta baja, daba al patio, con una puerta amplia que permitía el paso de la luz y salir al jardín, así que pudimos tomar café (tiene cafetera) en las mesas de jardín (donde por cierto, otros huéspedes salieron a trabajar). La entrada de luz fabulosa y, con una cortina extra que permitía cerrar el paso de la misma por la noche. La cama grande y muy cómoda. Un closet cerrado en donde podías tomar almohadas o cobijas extras si tenías frío (no fue necesario, nos tocó un buen clima en noviembre). 
Me gustó, puede parecer raro, que nos preguntaran si necesitábamos limpieza de la habitación. Optamos por decirles que no y que solo sacaran la poca basura que teníamos y pusieran agua. Estuvimos tres noches bastante agradables y tranquilas. La ubicación es bastante buena pues estás a una cuadra de la avenida que te lleva a la feria y, puedes optar por caminar (15min) o tomar un autobús (5min) a la FIL. Y hay varias cosas para comer y comprar (tienditas) cerca del hotel.
Regresaré de ser posible

Lo que no me gustó no tiene que ver con el hotel: si tomas un autobús debes tener el cambio exacto $9.50. De no ser así, la máquina no te devuelve el cambio y se queda con tus centavos que se suman al bolsillo de no sabemos quién. Así que, mejor caminar si vas a la FIL (tampoco recomendamos Uber o similar. De ahí al hotel al cual nos cambiamos la última noche -hubo un cambio de planes y por los días de feria no pude tomar otra noche ahí- el precio era carísimo. Guadalajara es carísimo en el transporte de esas aplicaciones.

El lugar está muy bien ubicado para ir a eventos dentro de la Expo Guadalajara, es una zona tranquila sin mucho ruido pero cerca de tiendas y plazas, el lugar es muy cómodo y tiene pocas habitaciones, está limpio, todos los aparatos y apagadores funcionan y se encuentra en buen estado, cuidan los autos, tiene cámaras en las zonas comunes y fuera del hotel, hay mesitas en la zona de alberca, la alberca estaba limpia y el personal fue muy amable en todo momento.

La cama era un poco rígida y solo tuvimos dos almohadas, yo estoy acostumbrada a usar dos y mi pareja también, eso fue lo único que nos faltó, además de cafetera en la habitación. Había una familia hospedada también que llevaba niños y se metieron a la alberca a las doce de la noche, lo cual incomodó un poco porque estaban haciendo mucho ruido y otros fumando, pero sé que esto es ajeno al hotel, solo lo menciono porque habrá huéspedes que no siguen las reglas ni les importa los demás y al ser un lugar pequeño puede que afecte a todos.

Everything
Well situated, close to all the sights in centro with everything within easy walking distance. Staff friendly and attentive. Good Wifi.
Super friendly staff, great location, very comfy bed, nice balcony!! Would definitely go back

Wow, the building itself is magnificent. The location is just perfect. Right in the city center, literally a few minutes walk from everything worths to look at. The rooms are clean and simple, but that is what we were after : a quiet and comfy corner we can rest after exploring Guadalajara's beautiful sites. Personell was very helpful and kind, breakfast was very delicious. Great value for the price.
The vallet parking was a little awkward- but perhaps just the thought that they took our car about 5 blocks away. Didn't suffer from it tho, it was just a little unusual.
Beautiful and comfortable, very close to downtown area
The room smelled a little funny when we first arrived
Very beautiful as soon as you step in. It’s in a great location and the room was big. Big enough for our family to stay in (6 of us). The staff was great, friendly, and accommodating to our needs.
Only thing was the hardness of the mattresses. They were a bit uncomfortable to sleep in. Other than that, everything else was great.
Very secure, great location, friendly staff
Clean, centrally located, excellent staff. Probably your best bet for mid range in the central plaza.

Location is amazing. 
They have free valet parking from 6am until 10pm.  
The building is an amazing old historic style.  It’s near everything.

They tried to get extra cash for using credit card but I refused anything outside my booking.com agreement.  
Finally they accepted.  But must be careful everyone.

Our room in this beautiful 200 year old hotel was quiet while on a busy pedestrian street.  Easy to go wander two different big plazas in downtown Guadalajara. The place is close to the Juarez subway entrance which allowed us to get around to different places in Guadalajara. 
The bed was comfy, the AC worked well, nice soft lighting, and the shower had great pressure with hot water!
Nice location, the host were very kind and help us all the time

Location is ideal for exploring the historic center of Guadalajara.  The hotel is very nice and quiet.  Great bedding.  Minor issue with the air the first night but it worked great the next nights.  You can also access the metro in 2 or 3 minutes.  Highly recommend.
The shower was not always hot but it was tolerable.
nice old house..kind people in the reception (they park you car in a different place)
The place is beautiful!
Everything was perfect, except that we waited more than 30 mins for our 🚗.

The hotel for being over 100 yrs old was beautiful and in great condition. Victor, the manager, was very kind and helpful in providing information about the city, food, tours, etc… The location was perfect with lots to see and many attractions are within walking distance. There is a subway/metro a block away so you can visit locations further out.
It was perfect for what a hotel over 100yrs old could offer

The location was close to everything.  The price was excellent value for money. Shower was always hot.  Wifi was great.  We had an inner courtyard room so no street noise.   
The staff is 24/7 and helped arrange our airport tramsportation.
The rooms were not well ventalated so it took a while for the humidity to leave after showers, but the mini split has a dehumidifyer setting which really helps.

The only thing I didn't like, that there were no curtains on the bedroom's windows!
A lot of light came in, so it would be nice to put some nice little, traditional Mexican curtains on.
Other than that, it was a nice stay, even for one night!

The hotel was very centrally located and within walkimg distance of a lot of attractions.  The staff was very friendly.  Despite the street noise, we could not hear a thing in our room.  I would stay there again.
We couldn't open the window to let some fresh air in.
Facilities are great!
Staff was very friendly and helpful. Facilities were very clean. Beds were comfortable and common areas were quiet and welcoming.
We liked everything about our stay.
the location

Perfect example of my favorite sort of Mexican hotel -- an older historic property. Nothing fancy, but clean, comfortable, well-located, and a great value. And the staff were friendly and very helpful.
It is right in the heart of Downtown Guadalajara.  It is nice to walk out of the hotel and enjoy the "plaza" atmosphere
AC could have worked better (less noisy)  Would love to have had a pool or jacuzzi

I liked the historic aspect and the architecture of this beautiful building. Also, the concierge, Victor, was very friendly and helpful. He recommended a wonderful restaurant for dinner and was so accommodating when we wanted to leave some bags after we checked out, so that we could sight see a while before leaving the city. The entire staff was wonderful.
Only the lack of a hair dryer and some Kleenex in the bathroom. Otherwise it was very good.
Excellent location, close to historic center, train, shopping and restaurants.  Super friendly staff, 24h at front desk. Good size room, hot water with good shower. Beautiful courtyard.
Able to hear all noise in hallways.

Beautiful historical building.  Location only a few blocks away from main square. Staff was always willing and happy to assist with any requests.  The shower is big and water hot with good water pressure. The towels-linens fresh and clean.

As noted by others the bathroom vanity is very small not enough room for toiletries  even one person . Had breakfast and it wasn’t that great, not sure why others thought it was good. l would suggest the great coffee shop next door if you want a excellent cappuccino or espresso.
Excellent service, beautiful building, great location, good price for quality

On premises restaurant serves good value breakfast. Staff were extraordinarily helpful and Victor was fluent in English. Beautiful restored historic building with atrium. Excellent value and location on pedestrian mall close to main square was great. La Chata and Casa Dolores are great authentic Mexican restaurant options within walking distance.
Room could have been a bit larger, however, understand that historic building places limitations

El estacionamiento es el mismo de la plaza, y en esas fechas de nuestra estancia estaba imposible encontrar lugar, nadie podía ayudarnos al respecto y tardamos horas en poder estacionar el auto y lejos de la puerta de entrada al hotel. 
Al ser mi esposo, mi bebé y yo, por varios días traíamos equipaje, más todo lo que la bebé requiere, carriola, pañalera, juguetes, etc, y no había Bellboy, que nos apoyara con el equipaje, tuvimos que pedirle a uno de nuestros familiares en Guadalajara, que se trasladara al hotel a ayudarnos. El día de llegada fue una mala experiencia para nosotros, la verdad. 
A la hora de querer pedir room service, tampoco había. Tuvimos que resolver con los restaurantes de la plaza, eso sí, todos deliciosos.

Regarding the Hotel by itself:
- The mattress seems that needs to be replaced soon. Apparently  my family and I noticed the same, in some areas of it it feels uncomfortable in comparison with our previous visit. At least the 2 beds in our room  were the same. Room 702.
Regarding Booking.com
- I received an email from you guys that says  about 10% credit promotion for future reservations if I complete the reservation by July 26th and spend more that 60dlls(captures included with dates and codes), however after I submitted  the order, the system no longer accepted the code as valid even it was ordered within the promotion deadline. Could you please help me that out ?? Thanks in advance.

I also when I check in I asked him to add an extra night but he never did and the whole time I was on my adventure the front desk kept harassing my mom by calling her every 5min. the facilities where great. The staff was amazingly helpful and the room was cleaned very well daily, fresh towels, fresh water. I felt very safe inside the hotel.

The location is a bit off the main tourist area of PdC. If you are not used to latin american coast cities the area can seem a bit sketchy at first specially if you arrive at night, But it is a short walk to the center and other amenities.

Room : perfectly clean. Bed linen clean. Towels new and good quality, clean also. Swimming towel are provided by the hotel. Great WIFI connection.
Rooftop /w swimming pool: very nice place to hang out, day or night.
Location : convenient, a walk away to the beach and close to the 5th avenue where there are a lot of shops and restaurants. 
Hotel Restaurant : fair price and good quality food, I enjoy every meal there.
Service : All the hotel staff contribute to a pleasant atmosphere. They are friendly, welcoming and helpful. 
Overall: I have a confortable stay at Terrasse Playa del Carmen, I recommend this place and I will certainly stay again here if I come to Cancun next time.

Personnel is excellent, always helpful and eager to find a solution. All the problems we faced were addressed timely. The hotel has very nice rooftop terrace, a small but very cozy and quite often with no people there so you can enjoy facilities in full. The location is also great, just 10 minutes walk from busy area but still quite and has free parking. Breakfast was excellent, one of the tastiest I tried during my four weeks stay.

Despite very stylish room, the facilities inside the room were a bit disappointing - there were just a couple of cloths hangers and no space for cloths and your personal belongings at all. So the only way is keep everything on three small available shelves (I would prefer to keep some personal stuff in boxes rather than highly visible). There is no air extraction system in the bathroom, so impossible to get cloths dry and after the show there is condensed water everywhere. At the end we managed to get additional hangers and one more table, but it didn’t resolve the issue completely and the room didn’t look very cozy with these two tables, cloths outside everywhere etc. Most probably there was better value for money.
Facilities were amazing! Extremely lovely and friendly staff, whom were very accommodating.
convenient location

when you entered to the room, there was all bad smell. we reported to the cs. they only said all of the room are booked. we booked two night, so we only can stay in the unclean room. Bathroom are all the black mold and stain on the floor inside. CS are not friendly and not helpful at all
Chair and curtain are many red stain, doubt that it is blood.

This place is really nice and comfortable. Near everything. Staff very helpful and friendly.
rooms super clean. Elevator in case to have a disability person like my mom with knees problem, a plus.

Great place to stay, very clean hotel and friendly staff. 
Roof top pool and out door area is amazing for those days you want to stay in.
nice and quiet rooms, good location
nothing
The design of the shower isn’t great but otherwise, things were good! The rooftop had an awesome view and lovely pool! Very enjoyable!

Great place, everthing feels and looks fresh. The rooftop area looks better than the pictures. Also nice food options nearby.
Great WiFi and very clean rooms.
The location is just slightly off. But by slightly, I mean like a few 100 meters. After that, the image on the streets starts looking better.
It was a cute place. Super comfy bed. no excessive noise. Nice little restaurant and pretty decor.
The options were really great and we all found something different that we liked for breakfast. The rooftop pool was great even though it was cold. The views were amazing.
Nothing could have been better. We had attentive staff that cared and helped us with every aspect of our trip. Everything was really great.
Hotel is located close to centre / main street. It not being on a key streets helps as it is quiet and calm place to stay. Nice view of the town from the rooftop terrace.
It is quite pricey for what it is. Maybe our stay on NYE commanded the premium, but generally it chargers more than it is worth. Hotel is decent economy hotel but nothing more. That must be noted.
cleanliness and staff
no dislikes, only issues not enough au beds
Location is perfect. Very close to everything but not right up in the hustle and bustle so it’s actually peaceful
Bed and pillows could have been comfier
the terrace and the decorations in the room
it was not in the best neighborhood
Nice personnel, free food in the mornings, nice and empty roof top terrace. We got vouchers for the beach club nearby.
Hotel's area doesn't look too nice. There's a kindergarten nearby with really really loud speakers. Playa del carmen itself is not a must see.
great rooftop terrace, friendly staff
the toilet did not work
Staff very polite and available. Great breakfast!!
The road the hotel is on is not fantastic

Big and spacious room
Available personnel 
rooftop nice with cool equipment and not too much people
free fruits at the reception

Shower : no pressure at all, we call the reception but it didn't changed a lot.
Sometimes it was only cold water, but the 5 days we stayed, no pressure at all.
And issues with the toilet too.

Beautiful room, good wifi, really good breakfast/lunch cafe thing within the hotel.
Helpful staff.
Huge bed
Aircon kept playing up, and not working properly

Good boutique hotel about 15 mins walking distance to the center. It’s v well connected via a walking street with a ton of restos & cafes. Room was nicely decorated, bed was pretty comfy. We only stayed one night but enjoyed the experience.

nice spacious room, clean and contemporary. large bathroom with everything you need. 
the rooftop area is a great sun trap with a pool and beds for sunbathing. all very clean. 
Location is away from the main drag, about a 15 min walk. 
close to Esmerelda beach which is quiet and seclude enough. 
some very nice local restaurants nearby too to try authentic cuisine.
blackout curtains do cover the full window which let in the bright sunlight. otherwise no issues.

The hotel is adorable on a more local street in town little taco stands on the road and small markets.  It had freshwater and tea available and a little café that was adorable! The girl at the front desk was a sweetheart!
The beds were too firm for me and the furniture had just been stained … there was a strong paint fume in the room… other than that I loved it there
Beautiful hotel with good facilities. Very modern, clean and good size room. Location nearby a nice food / shopping street.
Nothing!

Very nice friendly hotel. 
Staff were really nice and helpful ( they have 24hr reception!)
There is always free coffee, tea and fruit available by the reception.
Just outside the main 5th avenue. 
They give you access to Marina beach club which is very good with lots of sunbeds (try to go in the morning as they are all taken by midday!)
You are not allowed to take any food or drinks inside.
Sea should be lovely unfortunately when we were there there was a lot of sargasso which made it impossible to have a swim (this is everywhere not only here)

The shower- unfortunately the worst shower pressure ever. It was so minimum that it was so difficult to rinse my hair after shampoo. This is the only reason why I am giving a lowest score. A better shower would have made this stay perfect.
Room was very clean with a large comfortable bed. Modern and stylish interior. Exceptionally helpful staff.
Running toilet. Noise from road and works being done downstairs.
The corner in the lobby with free water, coffee and fruit.

kindness of the staff
room very clean
I like everything
Everything was terrific except the maintenance of the property. I wish they had maintained the shower and fixed the unpleasant smell wandering throughout the room almost all the time.
whilst a little out of town it was close to beach. rooftop pool area very comfortable. staff very helpful. nice restaurants close by.
Location and price was good. Also they gave us free entrance to one of the beach club very close to the hotel.
We experienced lack of water on the entire bathroom. Although they were very willing to help, it was still a little uncomfortable.

Comfortable bed, air conditioning working well. Hosts were very friendly and helped us every time, they even kept our bags a few hours after check-out. 
Access to Martina beach club (on request), but beach has plenty of sargassum.
Location: it is in a neighborhood that doesn't look very good. But on the upside there is always a parking spot and we never had any trouble. It is some 10-15mins walking from the 5th avenue.

Lovely comfortable rooms and bathroom. We had an issue with a dripping shower but the staff were quick to fix it.
Rooftop pool was nice a little chilli in the evening but a nice hang out spot.
Breakfast not included but the cafe was reasonable and nice to have breakfast in.
Staff very friendly and helpful.
Price very good for this hotel.

Wifi was strange there were different connections for different floors. Small inconvenience.
Location is not that central maybe 15 min walk which is fine in the day but not so much at night. I wouldn’t do it alone but ok with others.

Comfortable room. Small rooftop pool to relax during the day. 
Close enough to the centre to walk to the restaurants but far enough away that its not noisy. 
Free coffee / tea supplied in the reception.
Reliable air con.
WiFi was variable through out the stay, they do have a router per floor so often would connect to the one below as our floor didn't work for the first 2 days.
the room very clean
They offer terrace in each room and when arrive they tell you is a common rooftop

las instalaciones son espectaculares! la decoración es hermosa, y tiene todas las comodidades para pasar una excelente estancia!

QUE ME AYUDARON A CUIDAR A MI PERRITO CON COSTO EXTRA
la actitud de la señora del check in me grito que si no queria esperar ya que no estaba cuando llegue( llegue 4 p.m ) que cancelara con booking y a ver si me regresaban algo
me gusto que está nuevo, bien cuidado y es cómodo.
la persona que nos atendió fue desagradable siempre.

Das Hotel hnd die Zimmer sind sehr sehr sauber und auch die Angestellten geben sich viel Mühe und sind supernett. Die Zimmer sind geräumig und sehr modern und auch die Lage ist super, 300 Meter zum Beachclub und gleich an der 5. Strasse. Gegenüber ist eine Bar, kann für Leite mit leichem Schlaf Nachts bis 1.00 sehr laut sein.

Eigentlich hätte uns alles Gefallen, Gina und Daniel waren wirklich super und haben immer geholfen und auch mal einen Schwarz gehalten. Was für uns aber aber absolut nicht geht ist, dass uns am letzten Tag ein Bild gezeigt wurde von einem Kissenbezug und einem Badetuch was leichte Verfärbungen hatte, weil ich mit meinen eine Woche zuvor gefärbten Haaren die etwas feucht waren an das Kopfkissen kam und natürlich auch mit dem Handtuch abtrocknete. Kann man problemlos 90 Grad waschen (was bei Hotels standard sein sollte!) und weg ist es, mach ich daheim auch. Wir wueden aber stinkfrech zur Rechnung gebeten, es wurden 300 Pesos (15 CHF) eingefordert für die „Reinigung“, was für eine absolute Frechheit! In Mexiko bekommt man dafür eine ganze Badezimmerausstattung an Tüchern und ausserdem ist das doch ein normaler Verschleiss?!? Ich war echt ebtsetzt und habe das auch gesagt, stiess jedoch auf taube Ohren, stattdessen kam der Satz, ja das sind nunmal unsere Regeln und ihr habt ja auch nur etwa 70.- pro Nacht bezahlt da sollte es ja kein Problem sein. Keine Ahnung, mir fehlen immernoch die Worte… 
Ausserdem ein riesen TV, leider ohne Sender, ist also nur Deko. Auf Nachfrage was das denn soll hiess es, ihr könnt ja youtubefilme und Netflix schauen, normalen TV gäbe es nicht. 
Die  Türen sind ausserdem hauchdünn, wenn jemand auf dem Klo sitzt, kann man reden als würde die Person neben einem stehen, genau so wenn die angetrunkenen mitten in der Nacht durch den Gang torkeln und die Tür zuknallen.

Muy bien ubicado. Junto a la Quina Avenida pero se mantiene muy tranquilo ese tramo. Se puede descansar sin ruido y tranquilidad.

Sehr schöne Suite mit fast allem was es braucht in top Lage … Das Personal ist hilfsbereit und sehr freundlich. Housekeeping kommt täglich, also alles sehr sauber. WLAN top. Preis Leistung top. Ich würde wiederkommen….

Dusche hat etwas säuerlich gerochen.

The Location is very convenient and in a quiet street, although the balcony is right by 5th ave so expect some potential noise. Cleanliness is on point and comfort is good.

The blanket on the bed felt quite cheap. While in bed, you can here the neighbors. 
The communication with the owner is not the best, she has a weird attitude. I booked this place last minute late at night with same day check in. My flight was delayed and my suitcase showed up last on the band which delayed my arrival, plus I had to pick up my rental car where normally takes some time and then drive to PDC. This keep pushing my arrival time and owner had a very poor attitude about me check in late (12am). I understand was late at night, but I think if you´re on booking.com at least have the payment handle by the platform so we can do self check-in without having the owner wait for guests on premises for check in and to pay because there isn't someone on the front desk .She offered me to go to a different location double the price and me having to do the whole transfer on booking. This felt very sketchy. Very important, I had to transfer the money to a random account because they don´t have somebody on front desk to handle payments. Another thing, she called me 11:51 am and keep texting me for check out even tho I got there late at night. Not a little bit of compassion. Obviously, this is very unconformable for any guest. 
Anyways, I´m very thankful that besides this issue, everything work in my favor.
If you´re considering booking, the place is beautiful and it´s worth it.
Well-located at the quiet end of the main strip of restaurants and bars, 5min walk from the beach which was nice. The room is large and clean, coffee facilities plus a small kitchen. Value for money.

Very thin walls (you can hear everything happening in the hotel/other rooms), bed was hard and linen was cheap and scratchy. The renovation was clearly done in a cheap manner but the room price reflects that. Wouldn’t stay here again.
The location is great. Walking distance to restaurants and shops.

The water/plumbing went out several times during our stay. The wifi signal was very weak and unavailable at times. Elevator was out of service when we checked in and we had to walk up several flights of stairs with our luggage. At the time of checkout, the receptionist showed us a picture of a stained pillow and charged us for it. The linens during our stay were very worn and already had previous stains prior to our use. It’s very unfortunate that they charged us. Beds were very hard!

Great location - very very close to 5th avenue, with all the restaurants and shops and very close to the beach. The room was very spacious with a nice balcony. Bed was really big and comfortable and it was surprisingly quiet in the room at night considering it is close to a lot of movida.

The smaller details weren't there - the kitchenette was incomplete, there were big pots and pans but only three knives, two forks and one spoon etc. One mug and one wine glass for a room for two ( it was as if things gone missing over the years and they hadn't replaced it ) but we requested extras to the staff which they supplied. Some of the switches were a bit dodgy or didn't work and the hair dryer was broken. Overall was great value for money, and the staff was really helpful and available and they helped with any enquiry we had.
Great location and very helpful staff. Spacious room and bathrooms

The location is Excellent It is in the heart of 5th and 10th Ave close to bars and nightclubs, the room was clean and comfortable and the woman in the reception is the kindest person

Immaculate, comfortable rooms and excellent mattress.  Superb location close to restaurants, shops, Cozumel ferry and the beach. The staff were extremely helpful.  On the 4th floor there is a nice deck with a large hot tub.
The kitchenette had only the bare minimum  but it was adequate for preparing breakfast and the odd lunch.  No dishcloths were provided.
The facility was great. The staff was very friendly and helped out with any questions that we had. The rooms were very clean.

Great location. Central but still fairly quite.
Lovely huge room. Nice sun terrace on the roof too.
Really nice couple running the place. Very friendly and helpful.
Would definitely stay again.

The only thing was that the bed was really really soft.

A newer hotel in excellent shape, very clean, just off popular 5th Avenue but far enough away not to be noisy. Really nice bathroom and a great shower, good wifi, air conditioning, etc. There was a coffee maker and minimal utensils and a cup, and they gave me coffee for making one or two small cups. An OXXO, banks, restaurants, etc. are close by. My king bed was very comfortable. There was plenty of room, a table with two chairs, wardrobe, and desk. Everything was top notch!

When I arrived at 3 pm, the time I said I would be there, no one was at reception to let me in the front door. Two other people were standing there, ringing the doorbell and trying to get in. We spent probably 10 minutes calling, sending emails, and ringing the doorbell before someone finally came to the reception desk to let us in.

Staff and especially the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. They changed our room, because we didn't want the first option, where the balcony door could not be locked. it is located directly on 5th avenue. Of course it is noisy, but you possibly don't go to bed in Playa del Carmen at 9pm.

Central location, staff super-friendly and very careful, room very clean.

The room has a very old and noisy air conditioner and a noisy ceiling fan too.
I made a mistake with my reservation and even if I've tried to cancel it half an hour after I made it, the hotel told me it wasn't possible to do that without paying the full night. I know that those are the conditions decleared by the hotel, but I think it doesn't help the structure so much to be so unavailable with clients. I couldn't damage the structure so much canceling a reservation for the very same night half an hour after I reserved it, so it's just they decision to not be really available to the client.
location is good.
if there;s a microwave or coffee maker inside the room.
Best price for this location
Bed sheets dirt marks….
The location is amazing since is on the 5th Avenue

I didn't like how the restroom is, even the restroom is not shared, it has a small window in the corner that goes to the next room and is an open window that can't be closed, so you literally don't have privacy, you can hear everything of the next room and they can hear everything from your room.
 I lost the key and the charge was super expensive 😫 almost the cost of the night.
There is no elevator so don't forget anything, if you bad luck like me, you will get the room on the 4th floor jajaja

The workers were very Friendly. 
The bed was confortable

The location is right in front of a bar , if you book a room with balcony be prepare for that.
There was no shampoo or hand soap
Ia extremly hot in the entrace of the room due ti the AC devices 
No hot water (which is ok when is 30 degrees outside)
The bed was comfortable.

The room was dirty and the sheets were stained. I also did not have running water the first night. Staff informed me that nothing could be done, and offered no discount or refund. When the water finally was running it was lukewarm and a tiny stream in the shower. The small refrigerator in the room smelled horrible when I opened it. Also the place was incredibly hard to find. The advertisement at the front was for a massage parlor.
Kind atenttion from staff, always available to solve questions or requirements.

just on the main walking street, opposite to 7eleven and shops on the street
croaches in the bathroom, we killed two of them and next morning dead bodies were gone - probably eaten by their fellow friends. lovely
Location good, not even gonna comment that it was noisy as it was in the middle of the action so to be expected. Room and bathroom basic but clean and comfortable.

The communal area not nice, no one used it, stairs and corridors not great, and as there isn't a lobby, just an office, there's not really a feeling of being 'welcomed' as such, although the staff were super nice, friendly and helpful, so no reflection on them at all. Still a good, basic option for Playa del Carmen and convenient location - but it is noisy so don't book if you want a quiet night!
Location on 5th
If your a solo traveler who just wants to party on 5th it's alright a bit pricey but ya.
The location is right in the center of Playa del Carmen. Everything was within walking distance. Great for a one night stay.
No parking in the hotel, but the street was safe.
close to everything
a little noisy
Location is nice
No hot water in the shower and the TV was not working in room  :(
Clean, friendly staff, easy access, right in the middle of 5th ave. Great deal.
Right in the middle of 5th ave. = extremely noisy until 2am. Great if you want to stay in town to party. Not so great if you're a quiet person hoping to sleep early and getting a good night's sleep.
Wifi barely exists
I asked for a quiet room , did not get it, too noisy due the bars on the 5th Avenue.

The price for the central location was great. Also, the staff is very kind and helpful. We asked them for another room because the previous one was extremely noisy. We got a big one instead of a small one, still super noisy but that is the problem of the whole place.

Honestly, I do not understand why this accommodation has such a great rating. Yes, it has an amazing location on 5th Avenue which is advantages and disadvantages at the same time. The location is great unless you want to sleep (which a normal person usually wants to do at the night). If you like the idea of sleeping on a mattress in the middle of the dancefloor then this place is heaven for you because it is extremely noisy. Great for someone who wants to party hard and come back to the room wasted but not recommended for anyone who wants to sleep like a normal human being. Also, if you like hot/warm water then this is not a place for you because there is no hot/warm water at all. And the cleanness is the issue here as well. I mean it is doable but they could do better.

Berenice was the one who greeted me and she was super nice and amazing !
